inclusion.criterion: Patient must have an ECOG performance status of 0 or 1
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The diagnosis of invasive adenocarcinoma of the breast must have been made by core needle biopsy.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The primary breast tumor must be palpable and measure ≥ 1.0 cm on physical exam.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Tumor specimen obtained at the time of diagnosis must have estrogen (ER) and progesterone (PR) receptors < 10%.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Blood counts performed within 6 weeks prior to initiating chemotherapy must meet the following criteria: Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) must be ≥ 1200/mm3;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The patient is a 45-year-old postmenopausal woman
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: A core biopsy revealed a 3 cm invasive ductal breast carcinoma in the left upper outer quadrant.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The tumor is HER2-positive and ER/PR negative
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Axillary sampling revealed 5 positive lymph nodes
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: CXR was remarkable for metastatic lesions.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: T3 or T4 tumors including inflammatory breast cancer.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: FNA alone to diagnose the breast cancer.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Excisional biopsy or lumpectomy performed prior to initiating chemotherapy.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Definitive clinical or radiologic evidence of metastatic disease. Required imaging studies must have been performed within 6 weeks prior to initiating chemotherapy.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has a history of cytologically confirmed breast cancer and is postmenopausal, but the overall assessment is likely eligible due to the presence of metastatic lesions on CXR.
